titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Alumni
titleInfo.subTitle: Ted Holmes oral history interview, 1994

name.description: Ted Holmes was born in Forest, La., on March 23, 1930. While attending Louisiana College, he volunteered for four years of military service when the Korean War began. He transferred to Louisiana State University upon his return, graduating in 1958 with a bachelor's degree in social sciences. He received a master's degree from the LSU School of Journalism. Holmes held numerous positions editing or starting newspapers.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College--Faculty.
Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College.--School of Journalism.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Holmes discusses his family; editing and starting newspapers at U.S. Air Force bases; studying journalism at LSU; working for The Reveille; LSU faculty members; working for various Louisiana newspapers; and his public relations work for mostly agricultural agencies in Louisiana, Alabama, and Texas.
